meanings.sent1: After the storm, he had to readjust the sails on his boat.
meanings.sent2: She needed to readjust her schedule after the unexpected meeting.
meanings.sent3: Trying to readjust the crooked picture frame, he accidentally knocked it off the wall.
meanings.sent4: Life can throw unexpected challenges that require us to readjust our plans.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to readjust the engine to make the car run smoothly again.

meanings.definition: To make minor changes or corrections
meanings.sent1: She decided to readjust the font size to make the text easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The tailor had to readjust the hem of the dress for a better fit.
meanings.sent3: He quickly realized he needed to readjust the recipe after adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully readjusted the brush strokes to perfect the painting.
meanings.sent5: It's important to regularly readjust your budget to stay on track financially.

meanings.definition: To settle or resolve a disagreement or conflict
meanings.sent1: The mediator helped the two parties readjust their differences and reach a compromise.
meanings.sent2: They had to readjust their perspectives to find a solution that worked for both of them.
meanings.sent3: In the end, they were able to readjust their opinions and find common ground.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes it takes time to readjust misunderstandings and mend relationships.
meanings.sent5: Through open communication, they were able to readjust their views and move forward together.
